Desc: A better way to select fonts!
Name: Font Browser

Desc: Loads an image into SOPs (one prim per pixel) with the correct aspect ratio and scalable resolution
Name: Image Loader

Desc: Draws random lines between points with configurable distance and density
Name: Connect Adjacent Points

Desc: Shows how you can emulate Illustrator's pattern brush
Name: Path Deform Example

Desc: Utility to create a grid where each cell is a uniform square size
Name: Uniform Grid

Desc: An example of how to create concentric rings around text
Name: Text Extrude Example

Desc: Gives you the smallest perfect cube which encompasses an object
Name: Perfect Cube Bounds

Desc: Voxelizes a mesh into cubes with configurable resolution
Name: Box Voxelize

Desc: Generates a bowl shape with a configurable height ramp
Name: Bowl Generator

Desc: Extrudes a curve to fill in the space between it and the ground
Name: Extrude Curve to Ground

Desc: Turns the edges of one geometry into a knife to cut another geometry
Name: Split by Geometry

Desc: Downloads & imports retro game assets from models-resource.com
(Guide)
a
https://youtu.be/N4lg8wORTCg?si=c0sEvNrNUBd021ev
Name: models-resource.com
a
http://models-resource.com
downloader

Desc: Imports all assets in a folder and lays them out in a grid
(Guide)
a
https://youtu.be/nKA_zELIcLg?si=N_3iftpn7J37z6W-
Name: Asset Library Layout

Desc: A simple auto rigger for KineFX (not just for humanoids)
Name: Autorigger

Desc: A patched version of the built in Obj importer which correctly loads materials
Name: Obj Importer Materials Fix

Desc: A patched version of the built in Attribute from Map SOP which loads the Alpha channel, not just RGB
Name: Attribute from Map with Alpha

Desc: Split a vec4 volume into separate R/G/B/A float volumes (and merge back afterward). This is needed in order to manipulate RGBA images with Python, for example.
(Guide)
a
https://youtu.be/M3KA7Gul9LU?si=TtkdtlvrrqYxcXpx&t=1169
Name: Split / Merge volume

Desc: Simple utility which sets color to black or white based on alpha
Name: Alpha to Color (Copernicus)

Desc: A primitive Chromakey that sets alpha based on luminance threshold.
Name: Color to Alpha (Copernicus)

Desc: Sets color and alpha to 0 at pixels within a configurable threshold of similarity to a particular color.
Name: Delete Color (Copernicus)

Desc: Multiplies color by black or white probabilistically, based on luminance.
Name: Random Dither (Copernicus)

Desc: Simple utility which adds a marker at a particular UV location, with a particular size. Useful if you want to target an effect to a specific location and need to find the coordinate.
Name: Color Pixel (Copernicus)

Desc: Converts a color image to black and white based on a luminance threshold.
Name: Mono threshold (Copernicus)

Desc: Changes colors to their closest match in a palette.
Name: Quantize to Palette (Copernicus)

Desc: Finds the average / maximum / sum of two images's colors at the places where they both have positive Alpha. Inspired by Risograph printing.
Name: Color Mix Composite (Copernicus)

Desc: A minimal framework for processing images with Python. Processes all pixels in a single thread, so you don't have the same shader-style limitations as OpenCL or Vex. This makes it useful for integrating AI tools or for certain algorithms like pixel sorting
(guide)
a
https://youtu.be/M3KA7Gul9LU?si=o66c4ILPdikwg1x1&t=1168
Name: Python Processor (Copernicus)

Desc: A solver-based SDF growth algorithm that can make some pretty cool organic-looking effects
(guide)
a
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z_ITp4kebKM
Name: SDF Growth

Desc: An obj level subnet that lets you turn on/off a group of lights with a single click.
Name: Sub Scene

Desc: A simple utility to automatically press some buttons in sequence.
Name: Press Buttons

Desc: Parameterized concentric circles creator with optional sin distortion. Whoa, dude.
Name: Concentric Circles

Desc: A modified version of Entagma's SVG exporter SOP. See my tutorial on
creating a font in Houdini
a
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VJCSX4mJols
Name: SVG Export

Desc: Grows curves in sequence (built to emulate handwriting)
(guide)
a
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=83Gibdi2LXQ
Name: Draw Text

Desc: Combines multiple textures into a single atlas texture, and updates UVs accordingly. Useful for when you download a model that has multiple material assignments and you would prefer it be one material.
(guide)
a
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rwjTzptCGrw
Name: Combine Textures

Desc: Masks the points on a geometry which are visible from some other geometry. Not technically difficult, but just something I always forget how to do.
Name: Mask from Raycast

Desc: Makes a spiral around a curve. I used this for physically simulated curly hair.
Name: Spiral around Curve

Desc: Makes this particular triangular grid which is a building block for "sacred geometry" patterns.
Name: Sacred Geometry grid

Desc: Given some unsorted points, attempts to build a non-intersecting polygon by connecting each point to its closest neighbor. Useful e.g. for creating randomly generated shapes.
Name: Poly from Points

Desc: Splits each segment of a (possibly intersecting) curve into its own primitive
Name: Split Curve Points
